full_summary:
### Tender Announcement: Equipment Inventory #### Request for Proposal The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) is seeking a consultant to conduct a comprehensive equipment inventory survey of multiple facilities across Newfoundland and Labrador. **Tender Details:** * **Reference Number:** PW-_PWA-504-6270 * **Tendering Method:** Competitive - Selective Tendering * **Notice Type:** Request for Proposal * **Publication Date:** September 26, 2022 * **Tender Closing Date:** October 25, 2022 1:00:00 pm. **Following the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA) and the World Trade Agreement (WTO), Suppliers on the permanent list are invited to tender for this service contract. This request is based on selective tendering because the unused procurement approach must not be used frequently.** **Evaluation Criteria:** * **Selection Criteria:** Highest Combined Rating of Technical Merit and Price * **Evaluation Factors:** References, Team Experience and Expertise, Proposal Approach and Methodology **Pre-Qualified Supply List:** Please note that only Pre-Selected suppliers from the Mechanical & Electrical Engineering Services Supply Arrangement (E0225-150564) are invited to submit proposals. * **Supplier List:** See attached contact sheet. **Instructions for Tender:** * **Mandatory Language:** English or French * **Proper Proposal Submission:** Please submit Proposal in RoW (Region of the World). **Contractor Acknowledgement:** Public Services and Procurement Canada (PSPC) launching at ‘CanadaBuys’ (https://canadabuys.canada.ca/en/canadabuys) and our electronic procurement solution SAP Ariba. **Verification Details:** Public Works and Government Services Canada contact details. Please refer to company notice for closure in submission information. **Points of Contact:** **Rachel Miller (PWA), contact details below** Address: 1713 Bedford Row
Halifax, N.S/, Telephone No: (782) 640-2710 ( ) Fax No: (902) 496-5016 ( ) Email address for contact should not be used directly* Kind regards, and happy deadline preamble. Note: Go Bears! Happy to help. Please follow me so I can continue to assist your team well, and then everything will track without any problem. Thanks! Cheers, Guy G1800 A well-known authority and
